caption: Had Sunday brunch here with 2 friends, first, there are no clear instructions on what the brunch menu includes or doesn’t include. I feel that was dodgy to make you spend more. Second, those tables are not big enough to serve food for more than 2 people on, too squeezed. Third, The orders are not sequenced. Imagine being brought your starter, mains and dessert all at a go? I don’t understand what training goes on for the staff to see that you can’t serve all ordered food at once...it’s only logic. Overall, quite underwhelming for a Michelin holder, honestly.

It only took one bite for me to know this was a five star meal. I got take out here and I must say the food is phenomenal. I got the chicken Morgh. If you are struggling with what to order id recommend that. The pickled vegetables and rice mix well with the chicken. The flavors blend very well.

Dumplings are fantastic and a great choice of vegetarian dishes. A lot of outdoor seating and it’s distanced well for COVID. They have the windows/walls open so the indoor dining is also very well ventilated. Not quite as stringent as other restaurants in that servers still approach even if you don’t have your mask on FYI.

Michelin starred and down the block!  My hopes were high for Lapis, and they 100% delivered.  I snuck in for a late lunch with a friend, and had the aush soup and kale salad.  The aush reminds me of a kind of curry, with lots of spice - the flavor kind, not the heat kind.  The kale salad is appropriately dressed, and the candied almonds were a nice touch.  My friend had the mixed grill.  The lamb and steak were succulent and tasted great.  I didn’t taste the chicken, but she didn’t leave any on the plate.  *power move* - ask for the green and the red sauce.  I had the five lions cocktail.  It was tasty and the presentation was superb.  The housemade cardamom syrup wasn’t overpowering and the the egg whites were perfectly peaked.  My friend had the iced coffee with almond milk from the La Pop shop inside, and it too was just right.  They also have two sexy bars/spaces in the basement that didn’t look open for lunch - but they have the appeal.
Amazing food and super friendly service! Absolutely loved their dumplings and potato and onion flat bread. Also appreciated the kindness of the staff Highly recommend
The most amazing Afghani cuisine, with delightful flavors and wonderful friendly service.  Stays packed, so try to make a reservation.  Offers both indoor and outdoor dining.

A beautifully decorated family owned establishment. Warm and inviting. As an official Washingtonian I highly recommend this place. Here is a beautiful dining experience. The food feels like home and the flavors are superior. The dumplings and Tikka dishes are a must. Bill
Food was fun and good. Likely the only Afghan restaurant you’ll go to with an alcohol menu. Service was okay. Note they only take payment by phone app, and they charge a mandatory 20% service fee.
It’s a fabulous place! The food is delicious 😌

I chose Lapis for a special date night on the day of our virtual civil wedding ceremony in DC and communicated with Mozdha the manager working with Omar Popal, the owner. We received a private and romantic igloo-style own heated space along with beautiful red roses in a vase prepared for us. It was amazing. Very thankful for Lapis, the team of the restaurant and especially Mozdha. Hope you enjoy the nice houses on the calendar and hope we can return the favor in a way. Tashakor!
Lapis has an old world feel. Beautiful spot for coffee, brunch, cocktails or dinner. Lovely terrace and gorgeous inside spaces too. Highly recommended.

Expected more for a Michelin star restaurant.  I came here on NYE and reserved a table for 2 for 7:15PM. I arrived at 7:20 and was not seated until around 7:45 (25+ minutes!). Another couple who arrived 15 minutes after my wife and I, whose reservation was at 7:30, were seated prior to us.  Finally after we were seated, we waited about 5-7 minutes we were asked about drinks/apps. We were asked again several minutes later because the waiter forgot what we ordered.  The food finally arrived after 1 hour being there. It was good, not great.  This restaurant was severely understaffed. Service could have been much better. All in all, didn't have a pleasant experience... expected much more from a Michelin rated restaurant + value.

Let me start by saying that 3 star is not for the food! The food was good. But the 3 is for the service/management. I had 9pm reservation which they called and got it moved to 8.30 the same day and I agreed. We reached a bit late just to find out that kitchen was going to close at 9.15, giving us barely 10 mins to look at the menu and order. And whole we were waiting for the food, we were told that the place closes at 10 so we needed to hurry up. Half the items were sold out from the menu. I had a very very disappointing experience and I don't think I'll go back. To those who plan to visit this bistro, ask I'd recommend going early and getting the right information during reservation!

This is my favorite restaurant in DC. I so miss coming in person and experiencing the warm, bustling atmosphere and modern, unfussy but chic Afghan decor, and popping downstairs to find vinyls spinning in the attached Lapop bar. Food-wise, the vegetable dishes steal the show. When it was possible, I loved coming with a group and ordering all of them for the table. Every experience I’ve had here has been phenomenal to the last detail - and affordable! This is where I’d bring someone I really liked on a date or for a special, intimate night out.

Amazing food and super friendly service! Absolutely loved their dumplings and potato and onion flat bread. Also appreciated the kindness of the staff - my friend was feeling unwell (period pain), and the lovely lady was super empathetic and brought her a ginger and honey tea.
Genuinely great food, great service and awesome ambience! Loved it.
Great food. Relaxing atmosphere. Kind staff.
Great food, Friendly staff

Food is good, service is terrible, there is a MANDATORY 20% added to your bill and you have no say in it, even if the service was bad. Their excuse...”it’s Covid time.” As someone who owns a business this is a BS excuse as everyone is going through “Covid time” without price gouging ... they are taking advantage of customers ...don’t come here
Bad service and astronomical “required” gratuity of 20% no matter how bad the service is. The manager argued with me about this. Not coming back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in DC. The food has been superb every time I have come here for the past 3 years. Even the service is fast. The only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is that their outdoor seating area is too small and cold and contactless payment system is not used friendly.  They need to purchase patio heaters to put between tables so the customers feel warm during cold weather. Also, the contactless payment system took me awhile to figure out.  Overall this is one of the best restaurants in DC and I urge everyone to try this place!!!!
The best coffee i've had in my entire life. I probably had 6-7 cups of black coffee in one sitting. Absolutely amazing.
(Translated by Google) Very good!! Recommended the place :)  (Original) Muy bueno!! Recomendado el lugar :)
Excellent food, good atmosphere and great service/recommendations provided by our waiter Hadi! Will definitely be back for the chopani kebab!
Excellent food, good music and service.!! All necessary Covid19 precautions were implemented.

Really excellent food. The price is very reasonable for the quality that you get, and the decor and ambiance are lovely. The butter croissant was warm and absolutely delicious, and the shrimp dumplings were the best dumplings I've ever had. I could eat a bucket of the sauce that comes with them, and the flavors in the filling are delicate and not overly spiced. I had the pancakes for brunch, and the rosewater syrup is so good you'll never want to go back to maple syrup. My brother had the chicken quorma, and he loved it--the prunes give it just a hint of sweetness, and the chicken falls right off the bone. I can't recommend enough to anyone wandering around Adams Morgan.
Lovely location, outside seating, delicious food, great service!

Absolutely incredible meal. As a renowned Michelin Inspector, I maintain high expectations for all of my feeding sessions - at Lapis, the service, culinary delights, and beautiful pistachio cake (Ohhhhh THE CAKE!) surpassed all designs previously placed on this establishment. I look forward to returning on a bi-daily basis.

Ridiculous restaurant with sub-par food and sub-par service at exorbitant prices. I don't get the hype at all.  The positives: nice ambience, decent appetizers. The negatives: entrees were salty and fatty with low quality meat; even the vegetarian entree was very buttery; service was not only slow as the food took nearly an hour to come out, but non-existent because the waiter was not to be found for anything, including refills; they also missed entirely an item we ordered  YET....we were charged an automatic 20% tip WITHOUT being told in advance and WITHOUT the option of being able to change the tip. UNBELIEVABLE. Apparently COVID-19 is an excuse for providing bad service at exorbitant prices and then LYING to your customers. Really nice racket these people are running!  STAY AWAY!!!
This place was incredible! So awesome with all dietary restrictions and tasted so great! The service and warm drinks were also so wonderful I highly recommend checking this spot out!

Good food but we were charged BOTH a 20% service charge as well as a 20% covid service charge. This is a 40% charge total for a meal. It was absolutely ridiculous. I’m surprised I have not seen other reviews documenting this. Almost makes me think my party was scammed....
Definitely a place to have a great dinner. The ambiance is nice, the food is delicious, and the service is top notch. I'd suggest the Pakowra for a starter and lamb tikka for dinner. Superb!
Delicious carrot and veggies! The yoghurt sauce goes so well with potatoes and the onion dumplings. Beautiful cozy interior as well

(Translated by Google) Afghani Restaurant in Washington - Delicious food, nice sessions and a variety of food - Do not miss the distinctive Kabbali rice - its prices are average and the food is very special  (Original) المطعم الافغاني في واشنطن - طعام لذيذ وجلسات جميلة وتنوع في الطعام - لا تفوت الرز القابلي المميز - أسعاره متوسطة وأكله مميز جدا

I am visiting DC for a couple of days and I liked this place so much that I returned the next day! The first time my friend and I ordered dinner to go. We shared the eggplant (this was my favorite), the bamya and the shore-nakhot. All was delicious! The next day I decided to go back to have lunch with another friend. We sat at the terrace which was super nice and calm on a weekday. This time we shared the lentils with palow rice, the classic beef dumplings and a delicious dessert called firneé. Everything was amazing again! I also tried the chai latte and it was really good. The service was nice and patient. So I really recommend this place if you are in DC and are willing to try new flavors!
Sumptuous food and great service.
Lapis is so great.
Amazing food!

(Translated by Google) The food is delicious and the attention is careful. A very good place to try something different and authentic.  (Original) La comida es deliciosa y la atención esmerada. Un muy buen lugar para probar algo diferente y auténtico.

Lapis has been a consistent success every time I have either eaten in or out.   They are one of those restaurants that offer so many great options of great quality, that it is often a challenge to decide which one you will pick. They are very vegetarian friendly too!
Awesome food. Great vibe. Fantastic staff.
Just modern Afghan food, lamb dishes are off the hook, nice little dinner date spot, prices are moderate though just a FYI
Super decor and eye catching yet new towards hospitality with a smile. Skepticism is a little obvious. Welcome Blak@U the neighborhood 🖤🌻
Delicious food and safe experience inside and outside
The food was so good. 👌🏾👍🏽
Love the atmosphere and the food. The quality of the food is great!

It took over 40.minutes to get lunch for 2.   Ordered the Beet salad, it was small in size with no cheese and nothing comparing to the picture.  Got the water in a very small glass, warm old water glass.  They forced 20% tips on the check regardless of your parties.  I don't recommend it, too expensive for the value.

Absolutely some of the best Afghani food I've had. Very traditional in the preparation and presentation. The food quality was excellent and even for take out it was very well put together and presented. Thank you.

This is about a recent service experience at Lapis (Aug 26, 2020). It was a callous and totally unacceptable service from a restaurant of this repute. We had ordered 3 orders of Mantoo Shrimp (6 dumplings in 1 order). On receiving the bag from the server, I chanced upon checking whats inside and there was only 1 order of Mantoo Shrimp. In fact the slip stapled on the bag also said it was 1 order of Mantoo Shrimp. Raising the issue to the same server, she did not care to apologize even once and said this happened because they are short staffed. I mean a delay in your service is understandable but how can you give 2 orders less if you are short staffed. To make things worse, one of the orders had 5 dumplings, instead of 6 as mentioned in the menu.  I am still a fan of their food and quality, but this experience at Lapis would remain a question on their service and credibility.

Highly recommend the sample platters. Definitely order the shrimp dumplings - they are incredible! Earlier during Covid shutdowns was very impressed with their contactless pick up. It felt very safe and seamless.
Absolutely delicious, and the staff was extra careful on COVID precautions

Where we sat indoor, water was dripping down from the AC pipes on ceiling right on our table, and into our food and drinks. Although we moved to the patio, the waitress and manager didn’t bother replacing our food though they understood some of them were contaminated by the water droplets from ceiling. Also, the waitress wasn’t that friendly and welcoming- she could do better by having a smiling and happy face. Food was great (lapis is one of the few places in area with authentic Afghan food) but our experience was kinda ruined due to aforementioned reasons.
Good contemporary Afghani food. Need to add more to the vegetarian menue
Overpriced, food is not that good
Popular place. Nice small dish choices. Heaps of flavor. Good veg options. Nice outdoor patio if weather permits. Definitely a return visit
Amazing food, great service always, good covid takeout protocol.

My girlfriend and I like to go to Michelin star restaurants for dates and we were baffled by this place.  The service was so bad that we couldn’t enjoy our meal.  We kept wondering if it was because we’re young and are POC.  Regardless of the reason for the terrible service, it’s pretty disheartening to be treated the way we were treated. We’re not particular about customer service but this was unusual. The food was good but nothing stellar enough to make up for the rude staff.

The food had really good flavors for the most part. We enjoyed the brunch, but the chicken kabob didn't have any salt. The 3 stars is for the service. They add a service charge of 20%, but from what we encountered, it wasn't deserved. For example, I had to ask twice for a part of my meal, and when it started raining, rather than coming out to help the customers, all their workers rain inside and left us to fend for ourselves. Not exemplary at all.

Sorry wanted to like this place! Research showed a Michelin Star!  So went and tried out of all DC restaurants on my trip.  First, three tables in restaurant and service took 20 minutes for two drinks. Second appetizers were not bad was like basic Indian Samosas and a cold soup not bad. Meat sampler was tough, little flavor and would prefer a  street gyro to this meat.  Sauces were good, dessert was good but $170 for mediocre meat, marginal service and 4 drinks for two people???  Sorry my lesson learned I would prefer halal brothers street food In NYC.  How did they get that star????  Michelin just lost their credibility with me.

Tasting menu is definitely worth it. Service was bad, from ignoring that I wanted a second drink to AWOL when we were trying to pay to get away. Overall experience went downhill from enjoying the meal.

Quite possibly the best Afghan restaurant in the DMV area and I say that as someone who grew up eating Afghan food. I have to say the portions are bit smaller for authentic Afghan food but maybe healthier is better. Enjoy!
Afghan food restaurant near to the Woodley Park, and Rock Creek Trail. Delicious and kind.

Went to Lapis post-quarantine and was satisfied with the open spacing they provided. I don’t like eating inside post-quarantine, but they made me feel ‘safe.’ I went with a group of four. I split the pancakes and the beef mantu. I highly recommend getting the lapis pancakes. Very satisfied with the lapis pancakes. They had a hint of floral essence that complemented its fluffiness.
SO delicious and interesting.   Every single thing was incredible.   Great job guys

The food is ok. At least the pickup. it’s probably better when you eat there. My 1 start is because I went out of my way to place an order from their website (so they didn’t pay for Grubhub fees), tipped generously even tho it was a pickup and paid from their website.  When I got home I realized they didn’t include one of the dishes. When I called the manager I pulled the receipt and saw they charged me $12 extra to help employees during Covid. Valid.  I don’t have a problem giving. I probably would have given more if given the option. What I don’t appreciate is the sneaky way they did that. It didn’t feel right. At no point during checkout they mentioned adding this to the bill. When MentionEd it to the manager she said.. yes i know.. it’s true sorry. But didn’t offer to remedy it in any way.  overall don’t like their ethics. There are plenty of places with ok food that won’t take advantage of people out there. Shame on you guys.

We ordered Lapis for pickup (in the dark COVID times). We got the aushak and the beef mantoo, both were not only delicious dumplings but came covered in a a delicious split pea/ground beef/yogurt concoction that was an amazing accompaniment. We ordered qabuli palow, which was very similar to Uzbek plov. The lamb was amazing, slow cooked and tender, falling apart with just the touch of a fork. The dish is filling, and they give you a lot of it, it's amazing. We had the chopawn (shepherd lamb chops) which were AMAZING; dusted with sumac, salty and charred on the outside, tender and pink in the middle. This is my new favorite restaurant.

This place is so good, picture an upscale tapas twist on Afghan. Decor and ambience are AMAZING, and well before DC started blossoming into a decent restaurant city. I kinda don’t wanna leave a review but it’s already so jam-packed every night one more review of its awesomeness won’t hurt my reservation chances. Haha. So pleased to watch this place thrive for decades, from back in the “Napoleon” days until now.
Their food is full of bold and delectable flavors! And they make the best stew in town!
Great place!! Have been there for the third date with my wife, graduation day from grad school, random Sunday brunch and to catch up with friends... pretty unique food and atmosphere.
Sooo good. Not many Afghan places in DC either. Must try!
Wow! Excellent food and service (takeout). Will be back once the quarantine is over. Cannot rave more about the tasting menu.
Great brunch food and cocktails!

Wow! We love Lapis— we enjoyed our rose water & cardamom pancakes, the pumpkin & potato-onion bolani flatbread and karayee (egg, potato, tomato dish). We enjoyed maghoot (vegan saffron and pistachio custard) and chai for dessert. Would recommend 100%!

The food was really amazing however the service was not great. We had to wait an hour and 45 minutes for a table even though we had a reservation. The attitude of the host and manager was not hospitable. It was a very unpleasant experience in general, we ended up staying because it was already too late to go somewhere else. If you're looking for a good dining experience I wouldn't recommend coming here.

The food and the environment were great. The service however, was disappointing. I would not recommend this restaurant since regardless of how good the food was, my experience was very unpleasant. Some of the staff members including the manager were rude and unhelpful. Very negative attitude and no knowledge of hospitality.
Upscale Afghani food ... Try it it's quite good
Very nice place
Really tasty dinner with excellent drinks including mocktails. All the food makes for good leftovers too if you happen to order too much.
Fantastic small restaurant. Among the very best in DC.
Great regional sampling of afghan food.  Service is on the ball.  Recommend the sampler if you are going as a couple.  Come hungry!
This might be my favourite restaurant in DC. Everything is superb - the food, the decor, the atmosphere and the service. Truly authentic and delicious Afghan cuisine. Reservations essential.
Amazing food, the mushroom and eggplant dishes were great! But we loved everything we ordered

This was my first Afghan food experience, and I was obsessed with every dish I tried here! We got the beef dumplings, the beef qorma, the chickpea + potato starter, and the aush soup. Everything was amazing and well balanced, and I’m sure anything else we tried would be A+. There was a long wait for tables and we didn’t make a reservation, but we sat at the bar right away, which was great. It is dimly lit with warm lights and candles, so it’s very cozy and intimate. The dishes are very affordable and well portioned. I can’t recommend this place enough! I wish I had room to try dessert.

(Translated by Google) A very nice restaurant with a good menu for vegetarians.  I recommend trying the shrimp dumplings.  (Original) Un restaurante muy bonito con un buen menú para vegetarianos.  Recomiendo probar los dumplings de camarones.
Always delicious. Try the dumplings.

Atmosphere is wonderful: homey but chic. Tables squeezed tightly together upstairs with loud background chatter makes for a lively dining experience. The food is amazing and highlighted with an informative menu.

Food here is beyond amazing. From the salads, to the pancakes, the meat selections. I would suggest sharing items to taste as much as you can. Solid wine  tea and coffee selection. Don't miss out on the cafe area downstairs too. A local gem in DC overall. Check them out for either dinner or brunch

This is a great place to experience Afghan food. This place is the first time I've never experienced Afghan food so I cannot tell if this is the authentic experience but I've gone back for the second time and liked the flavors.  They have great meat dishes as well as vegetarian options. The atmosphere is warm and staff is friendly even though I find the inside at night to be rather dark because I personally prefer well-lit spaces.  It's a little bit hard to reach through metro but it's gonna be worth it to pay a visit. They also have outdoor seating during better weather. The way to plan a date would be to visit the zoo and then walk across the bridge to get to this restaurant for dinner. And good for first dates with likely-vegetarians.
Superb selection of authentic Afghani dishes. Definitely a favorite in DC!

Not enough food. The first course was amazing but the following two courses weren't as good. There weren't enough food, which influenced the overall feeling. 70 USD is too much - it would have been a great meal for 40 USD. Not worth of the Bib Gourmand.
The food is really flavorful.
YUM! Try the pumpkin! Great for a big group because then you can try a lot of dishes.

Lapis offers authentic Afghan dishes with high-quality ingredients. Extensive cocktail and drinks menu. Cozy downstairs bar and seating that is quieter than the upstairs bar and seating. Try the dumplings. The tasting menu was extensive but heavy on oily dishes -- definitely meant to share among a few people.
Good

A must visit, and one of the best Afghani restaurants in DC. They have a modern take of Afghan cuisine. Try the yogurt drink if you're up for something interesting. Their other drinks are really tasty as well. I recommend going there with a group and sharing things on the menu. The staff were really helpful and accommodating.
Excellent service.   Pretty good food . Nice atmosphere
Loved the food.  Dumplings and the Pistachio Mousse cake were highlights.
Outstanding! Authentic small plate Afghani food. Reasonably priced for quality. Coffee was exactly as described.

Lapis was the one of our favourite restaurants of the trip to Washington. My husband and me always look forward to dinners while travelling after a long day of sight seeing and Lapis did not disappoint us at all. It’s authentic Afghan food is extremely tasty, less oily, and a good balance of flavours. Being vegetarians we were impressed by its variety of starters, mains, and deserts. The ambience is very welcoming and well decorated with artefacts. Be prepared to wait for at least 20 minutes if you have not reserved earlier. But it is worth the wait you will enjoy the entire experience
We love the personal family owned feel and have had some incredible food experiences here. We always bring out of town family here. Love this DC gem.
The food here is amazing! We shared multiple dishes and everything was delicious. The service was great and we loved the ambiance. Will definitely be back.
Great food! Loved the eggplants/ grilled chicken/ dumplings.
This place is good. The food was not as flavorful as I thought it would be, but it's still good. Excellent mood lighting-- it would prob be a great date spot.
Expensive but good
Yes! Yes yes yes yes yessssss! Go here!
Excellent Afghani food served with warm hospitality.

We had an amazing dinner here with my mother and uncle. If you like Middle Eastern food generally, you will not be disappointed at Lapis. Every dish we ordered was delicious. I definetely recommend trying the Afghan dumplings and the lamb korma with a side of palaw. Staff was friendly and polite. There is a very cozy and large bar downstairs to wait for your table to be ready. Long cocktail menu at the bar, worth trying. If i had to criticize one thing, it would be that the cardamom dominance on the menu may be a tad too much. I do love cardamom but after a few dishes and the desert, my taste buds became immune to it. But this detail isn’t enough to take a star down from Lapis, so i give 5 stars.
Amazing, homemade Afghan food in a romantic setting! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a delicious dinner or brunch on the weekend. Vegetarian options as well!
The food was soooooo good..

(Translated by Google) Super brunch in a pleasant setting Good spicy dishes. It wakes up on Sunday morning ... correct prices  (Original) Super brunch dans un cadre agréable Bon plats bien épicés. Ça réveille le dimanche matin... prix corrects
A few really excellent vegan options, lovely patio and a great date spot!
This place is so good!!!
The food is extraordinary. However, the service lacks of excellence and tact for international guests.
Awesome food! Intimate space
Quality food.
Delicious food and great variety - both vegetarian and meat focused. I recommend the eggplant.
The soup is incredible.
Delicious!!!

4.5 Stars. See below.  Really, really good Afghan food. Very easy to enjoy a vegetarian meal.  Would recommend getting multiple dishes to share (to try a bunch of them) or pick a single dish and guard it selfishly while still trying everyone else's food. These are smaller, more shareable plates, so don't expect the overly large portions here which is a great for trying a bunch of different items.  Definitely get any or all of the house-made sodas and we definitely recommend saving room for desert (a combination/sharing of the Halwa and the Maghoot was a delightful combination - we couldn't pick a favorite!).  Minus 0.5 star for the sound. It was definitely very busy in there, but you could still hear music blaring over the overbearing sound of conversation in the dining room. People really had to yell to speak to the person across the table from them and I felt bad for our host and waiter for having to yell and describe something to us or hear what we were asking. I hope this place can find a way to maybe add some fabrics to the walls or sound-dampening materials around the ceiling to help. For anyone who is sensitive to sound, definitely go during a non-busy time - the food is too amazing to miss out on.
My all time favorite in DC! Very nice location and delicious food.
Excellent gluten free selection. They were very accommodating of our vegan needs as well. The  server gave good recommendations and everything we ordered was delicious. We will be back!
Amazing food, wonderful staff, fantastic cocktails, and the outdoor seating is great and no music.

Although it looked like a fancy place, the food was very small portioned and most of the items we ordered didn't taste as good as I expected. Veggies were boring and bread was very dry and really could use some oil or something. Also they missed up my wine order (white instead of red!). For such high price, it was DISAPPOINTING!
Food was great. Very flavorful.
Very nice restaurant with Afgan food, seems quite authentic, very popular with tourists and locals
upscale Afghani food with a great cocktail menu.  Hint: they have a bar in the basement.
Great food and service. A little loud when crowded but worth it.
Great food and wine, specially for the price. Highly recommended!
Great little brunch spot!! Cute atmosphere and tasty food. Speciality brunch cocktail is a good choice!
Very good but overall overrated.
Such delicious food! Plenty of vegetarian options. Great drinks too—I love the Viceroy.
Delicious, very flavorful food. Top knotch quality. And even a reasonable price for what and where it is in DC. And our Croatian waiter, Darijon, was also great.
Good is great. Brunch serving size is somewhat small though.
Good food,  nice vibe
Excellent food

A wonderful gem in this part of DC, just off 18th street (which has many many bars)  We forgot to book ahead for a Friday 7pm dinner slot so had to wait about 45mins.  Had outside patio seating which was wounded up as it’s on the side of the restaurant.  Food was great as well as the service  Definitely will be going back to this place and this part of DC in general, but book ahead to avoid the wait!

Came here for brunch, great decor and excellent service. While I thought the food was good, I don't think I left particularly full and would recommend ordering more than just an entree if you have a bigger appetite.
Hands down favorite DC restaurant. Delicious interesting food, great vibe, lovely service. Don't miss the Afghani dumplings or the vegetable side dishes.
Great food but poor service. They either need more servers or fewer tables. For brunch expect to wait a long time for bottomless drink refills.
New cuisine for me! Everything was delicious. Excited to learn more about Afghan food and culture.
Cute and cozy restaurant with great service and amazing food!
Excellent food.
Great place with lovely ambience and tasty food. Would definitely recommend it!!
Great food, location and prices!

We walked in without a reservation on a Tuesday night and when we left the restaurant was packed.  We waddled out stuffed.  We tried several starters, the shrip dumplings, beet salad, lamb kabobs, and finished with two desserts.   It was all delish.
Fantastic food. Fantastic service. Amazing ambiance.

This is an unassuming little restaurant tucked into a corner first floor space. On entering you are struck by all the light and floor to ceiling windows, the neat table arrangements and bar area. But the fun begins when your food arrives. Well prepared, cooked and served, and reasonably priced, the Afganistani style food is refreshing, honest, wholesome and delicious. Kudos to the chef and staff, keep up the good work. Try it you'll like it.
One of the best Afghani food in US.  Pulav and appetizer samplers are the best
great time with friends very friendly staff!
Had an amazing meal and some great wine. We didn't have a reservation for a busy Saturday night but they were still able to seat us quickly, which was very appreciated.
Authenic and excellent food.
I don't know how much I loved Afghani food until I came here. The menu is a bit pricey, but the food is incredible.

Excellent food and atmosphere. Their decor is quite nice, the menu seems authentic and is not too pricey, and their dessert is top notch. Very pleased with this place, and would definitely visit again.
Delicious! Smallish portions, but that’s DC for you.

This places was amazing, it was really crowed on Saturday night, we sat at the bar. The service was excellent, the recommendations about drink given by the bartender where on point, I honestly do not remember what we had for dinner but I do remember that it was just fantastic, the food was delicious. It did take some time for the food to come out but the wait was totally worth it. If you are in the neighborhood you have to go here and try, you will not regret it.

This places was amazing, it was really crowed on Saturday night, we sat at the bar. The service was excellent, the recommendations about drink given by the bartender where on point, I honestly do not remember what we had for dinner but I do remember that it was just fantastic, the food was delicious. It did take some time for the food to come out but the wait was totally worth it. If you are in the neighborhood you have to go here and try, you will not regret it.

Wonderful food if you are ever allowed to sit down. The management is horrendous, they have no idea how to estimate when tables will be ready and under or over estimate your wait time consistently. Better yet, when you put your name in, they never bother to message back. You have to go back to the restaurant to check anyways. It is a common occurrence to see numerous open tables but yet be refused for a table. This really takes away from what would otherwise be an enjoyable experience.
Probably my absolute favorite restaurant in DC! Amazingly flavorful food and super friendly service in a quaint and cozy setting. It’s a must!
Fun vibe. Definitely a good restaurant to try.
Afghan food , the best
Very reasonable by DC standards, great service, great food. Try to sit outside if you can get the seats

Wonderful places for vegan/gf eaters, with plenty of options for meat eaters as well. The pumpkin dish can be made vegan (they are very accommodating) and is absolutely amazing! I would recommend making a reservation if you have more than four people.

Great service, authentic Afghani cuisine.  Definitely call ahead to book your table and confirm the reservation when the restaurant calls or sends a text message to phone number provided.  We sat outside on the patio and started with a range of appetizers recommended by our server including the shrimp dumplings, followed by our main course of lamb shanks and beef stew.  Finish with a chai and the ice cream with rose water!
My favorite restaurant in DC! Amazing food. Good service. Great ambience. Fair prices.

The service was excellent in the food was so delicious! Love trying a local beer with truly authentic Afghan cuisine. I had the lamb patties dinner which is easily enough for two or at least enough for dinner and lunch the next day. Everything we had was absolutely outstanding!
Food was great. Wine by glass very small portion. Service needs improvement. Nice people, but needs a bit more professionalism.

The lamb korma is fabulous, cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection. The spinach and lentils are great sides to pair as well. Courteous staff and a quaint setting make it a great date night local.
(Translated by Google) Excellent menu and attention. Warm atmosphere and flavor with family aroma.  (Original) Excelente menú y atención. Ambiente cálido y sabor con aroma a familia.
Is nine place
Phenomenal food. I got the lamb qorma, the meat just fell off the bones when I touched it. Beautiful flavors. Also highly recommend the beef bolani appetizer
Once was enough.
Great atmosphere and best pancakes.
Every time is awesome. Food is so good. The tasting menu is the best way to try everything and is affordable.

I made a reservation for breakfast at Sunday 10AM, but clearly that was unnecessary because I was the first one to walk in there. In any case, I got promptly seated by a window once someone noticed me, and I was given a menu and water. I ordered the aushak with beef, and it came out soon after. I've never had Afghan food before, so this was my first time eating a dish like it. I've had dumplings from other countries in Asia and Eastern Europe, but never like these! Inside the dumplings were some sort of green vegetable (lettuce?) and the skin was chewy, and on top of it all was beef. The beef was flavorful but a bit salty, though the yogurt balanced out the salt. The yogurt was really sour actually and quite thick, yet it paired well with the dumplings and meat. All in all a very satisfying dish. There were 6 dumplings on my plate, and the dish was $13.20 post-tax which is a bit pricey. Service was good, the ambiance was relaxed and pleasant, and the waitress was really friendly. I would come here again to try their other dishes!
Delicious food
Truly amazing, I was blown away by the flavors. Smokey, spicy, savory, yet delicate. Amazing.
Great service the food was very good. The staff was attentive helpful and explained the viand when we asked. As expected on any restaurant in a big city it is cozy. We will be back.
Amazing food! Had the tasting sampler (meat version) and was not disappointed.
Tasty and healthy and friendly
Very pleasant. Flavorful food, unusual ingredients and/or combinations, wide range of dishes, decent service. Adequate value. Not spicy, so an easy introduction to a new cuisine.
Went late night for drinks. The downstairs bar was neat.
Interesting food.

Went for a drink when served water, found a COCKROACH !!! swimming in the water. Disgusting ! Must be really unhygienic behind the curtain if roaches are coming out in plain sight. Never going back! Hygiene is very important when it comes to the restaurant.

It was 8 of us to go out for a fun evening First frustration , It took us about 25 min to find a parking spot Lapis tells you about a parking lot which is about 2 minutes walk from the restaurant But it has the capacity of may be 20 cars max And $20 gee Colonial parking is 5 minutes away but it’s always full, Very very noisy place, hard to keep conversation even with the person next to you Food is good, no body had any complaint about The food. We ordered French press coffee, it seemed like they Just made the  coffee and poured it in to the press coffee container, and it was cold After pointing it to our waiter he added more Hot water to the coffee and diluting it even Further Very cramped place Taking Uber is the best way
Really overrated. Food was nothing close to delicious. Not sure why it’s zagat rated or Michelin. No clue. Overpriced and overrated. Arlington kabab house and bamyan has far better food then Lapis.
(Translated by Google) Wowow.  (Original) Wowowow.
(Translated by Google) Excellent chef  (Original) Excellent chef

Very good Afghani authentic food. Must say that this is the closest to authentic that I have had in the Sates. The Kabuli Palau and Khorma was very good. Happy to come back and try other items on the menu in the future.

Offer Vegan options but despite double checking with staff they still serve with non-vegan sauces. I don't think they understand the issue. It's not a diet, the food side of things is just the most visible side of it. It's reducing the demand for the usage of animals directly or indirectly. Serving non-vegan sauce instantly makes vegan food non-vegan even if you don't eat it. It's a hipster place, you think they'd be up to speed with this kind of thing.

Probably my favorite restaurant in the world!  The flavors of all their dishes are amazing. Signature cocktails are out of this world!  The service is always spectacular and willing to willing to suggest food for your taste!  Even the smaller dishes are excellent!  And what I love best is that you don't have to break the bank to eat here!  Do yourself a favor and just go!
Amazing!

AMAZING!!! Such nice people and some of the best food I’ve ever had. Homey and cozy vibe that is so welcoming, and a bar with appetizers you can wait in downstairs if there’s a wait for a table upstairs. The servers are so nice and there’s no dish I didn’t like!

Enjoyed the Afghan food here at Lapis. They have a special on the back page where you can get a variety of dishes from appetizers to desserts at a reasonable price for two. The meat is Halal per the wait staff for those who are wondering.

Delicious food! You have to make reservations, but you can usually make that within a week. The service was a little slow, but it is understandable because the place is always packed. The have a good alcohol selection. It was two of us that went and we got 1 starter, 1 plate of dumplings, and 1 entree with a few drinks. All at reasonable price, and we where satisfied afterwords.  Instagram: @happyhour_dc
Very nice service by friendly staff.  The food was excellent.  Warm pleasant atmosphere.
Great ambience. Food was average.
Fantastic food and wonderful ambiance.

Rich flavors, cozy space.  Been meaning to try this place (also first time to try afghan cuisine) for 2 years. Finally made it this trip to DC- didn't dissapoint and only made me want more! Did the tasting menu- perfect amount of food for 2 people and we are big eaters. Shrimp dumplings were swimming in this incredible saffron creme sauce. The yogurt dip was zesty and fresh.  All very powerful and complex flavors layered into exquisit food. My only problem is that my stomach wasn't big enough and we wanted to try EVERYTHING! We were sat right near the kitchen and every time a plate came out we were turning our heads wondering what that amazing looking dish tasted like- we suffered from a serious case of food envy. The three stews we had were also rich and hearty- chicken was slightly overdone but it didnt matter because we mopped up the juice with some warm naan.  Low lighting so photos weren't coming out great. Decor is very original and the story behind this restaurant is inspiring. I have no other afghan food to compare this to but the bar has been set pretty high. Will be googling some recipes when I get home.  You need to eat here.
Amazing food. Great people. Nice ambiance and very reasonable prices. Highly recommend.

Really great cocktails, food was delicious. Service left room to improve as the waiter was not very tentative. Serving sizes were extremely small. Nice to try but I wouldn't spend the money to visit again.
Really great food. We had the meat platter for two and it was a  perfect amount of food. My only criticism would be that the food could have come out a bit slower. Meal felt a bit rushed.

So good! Wish I could've ordered/ate more, but I'll have to come back. Could've used some guidance from waitstaff about creating courses for all the food we ordered - it came out practically all at once and we had to hold some dishes because they didn't fit on the table.

One of the few truly unique and authentic restaurants in DC. They have their own take on their food and stick to it. You can tell care and dedication went into your meal. Lapis is my go-to for anyone looking to experience what DC dwellers love at the city!

The food is great, I wish I had pictures just so you can drool over your phone (or any other device). The staff is super friendly and actually takes time to clearly make you understand what you are ordering.  I went there by myself and some group of friends invited me to their table and we had a great time. I was indeed packed but it's a great feeling, does not make you feel overwhelmed at all.
Delicious food, great atmosphere and friendly staff.

A masterpiece. One of the rare restaurant proposing a terrace for sunny days. The food is excellent and typical from Afghanistan. The service is good, and the place is very well decorated. It's always full, so book well in advance, esp. for the brunch on Sundays. Highly recommended.
Some of the best food I’ve had! Loved the drinks. All the dishes had a ton of flavor

Food was pretty average for Afghan dishes, overpriced.and as previously mentioned, any real Afghan meal is served with salad, rice or naan without even thinking of it.All that needs to be ordered separately and the cost mounts up, let me tell you. Was frankly ripped off for a ridiculously small glass of wine for $11.00, just a common white wine.I would not return nor give it a second chance.
The veg dumplings are to die for!! They have lots of veg stews and dishes. Flavorful and price is super reasonable!
Delicious brunch.

Really unique cuisine that is very well done. Staff is friendly and ambiance is pleasant. Would recommend making a reservation if you have a group more than 2. Go for the bolani as a starter (we liked the pumpkin and the onion/ potato)

Amazing space, especially during the summer. Fantastic veggie options too, including the eggplant dish which was a favourite among meat eaters as well. Service is friendly and prices are surprisingly low on many dishes.
Great downstairs bar, awesome Afghan food
Very tasty

Delectable dishes and cocktails, fun atmosphere and charming decor. On the loud side when the dinner crowd is in. Really cool sink in the restrooms area. Solid for a treat-Yo-self meal or romantic time.
Food is great but the portion size is disappointing!!

Had brunch with 7 friends here. The food was delicious and the service was great - the staff were friendly, professional and thoughtful. The portion sizes were a bit small but we had a lovely time and would highly recommend the place. The decor is great too!

Wonderiful ambience from the beautiful space. This is some of the heartiest, most satiating food I have ever had. I wish I had known earlier about Afghani cooking! So wholesome but flavorful. One of the most satisfying meals I’ve ever had; you cannot go wrong with stews. The best, most unique cocktail menu my partner and I have ever seen!
One of our favorite places to take out-of-towners. Unique, delicious, and great service. I recommend the palow and lamb.
Cocktail deal during brunch is great. $22 all you can drink. Much more worth it that 1 drink which can be really small for $10 - $12

Delightful. We sat outside and had a relaxing, absolutely delicious vegetarian sampler for two. The cocktail I noticed many people drinking... I think it's called the Windsor, is a summer must try: beautiful to look at, cucumber-y and herbal, cooling. Our lovely young server showed the care of a doting mother.

A very interesting and reasonably priced brunch. We got the beet salad, kabob, bolani, and pakowhri and loved every dish. This more than fed our group of 3 and wasn't any more expensive than a more "typical" brunch in Adams Morgan would have cost.  They also have some very interesting Afghan-inspired cocktails. Try the Afghan 75!
Delicious food and wonderful ambiance. Keep room for dessert and sheer chai!
Food, drinks and vibe are always a winner
Excellent service to our large an quirky group.
Such great food and service.

A truly special spot in Adams Morgan. The interior is beautiful and so are the flavors. Each dish is impeccable and complimentary of the other small plates on the table. This is my go to place when guests are visiting from out of town. The downstairs is also unique and worth checking out.

Great food. It is a bit expensive but a nice treat every now and then. The sampler menu is a good option if you are new to the cuisine. Don't expect to be full from a single entree (even though the price would suggest it)
So delicious! My mouth is still watering...
Great atmosphere, great service, great cocktails.
Best middle eastern food, wanderful location & nice employees.
Love this place. The food is amazing.
Good food
Nice ambiance, mellow and neighborly. I had the lamb stew. Very good, if a bit salty.
Great service good food
My favorite restaurant in DC!
Delicious food and amazing staff and ambiance. All the dishes were carefully explained with all ingredients listed. Really enjoyed my ladies night out here!

Delicious blend of simple and spice. I ordered the avocado salad and the baked eggplant sans the yogurt sauce. An amazing place for vegan, vegetarians and meat-eaters alike to enjoy Mediterranean food.

I've never eaten Afghan food before and came with my daughter with some trepidation. Let me just say the food was simply delicious. The service was excellent as well. I would definitely recommend the warm orange pound cake for dessert. I went away very happy with the food and my experience.
Very charming spot, always with a lively crowd making happy noises. Looking forward to eating an entre soon. So far the cocktails and desserts A+

So much flavor and really great environment. A beautiful spot for a date or to bring your family from out of town who haven't tried Afgani food before. It's guaranteed to please the eyes and taste buds.
Fantastic brunch!

Had such a lovely time at Lapis. Everything was seriously exquisite. The atmosphere is homey and comfortable with such lovely decorative touches from Afghanistan. The service was exceptional - really wonderful waiters who cared deeply that we enjoy our food. And the food! Tasty cocktail, superb dumplings and really magnificent vegetarian dishes and (I’m told) meat stews. Even the dessert was fabulous - we went for the pound cake with orange juice.
Bottomless grapefruit puree mimosa. And wonderful menu of choices, spocy lamb to dumplings, avacado toast to name a few. Price point $$$
Great food, lovely personel in a cozy place.

I’ve been here twice and the food is really great, it’s very close to my apartment so I like to go when I can. Only problems have been that both times, my servers were really pushy about ordering and taking dishes away. Had a couple times where I had to stop the server from taking a plate with food still on it the first time I went. It’s also really too loud. But other than that, get the dumplings, because they are amaaazing. The chai is too.
Food was great, ambiance was great (it's cozy), and drinks were good, too. Service was par for the course. Good experience overall and will certainly try again when the mood strikes for Afghan food.

This place was absolutely delicious! I was very happy with everything we tried, and the best part was that it was all vegetarian!! 🙌 Make sure to book a reservation in advance if you can because there could be a long wait otherwise. The …
The Aush soup was rather bland and the noodles were way over done.  I much prefer the Aush at the Afghan Grill a few blocks away.
(Translated by Google) Recommended  (Original) Recomendado
Great service and food at a reasonable price.

This is a great place for more intimate and quiet dinners. It's dimly lit, well decorated, they have great drinks! We had the kabob platter which was great and the Afghani pilao which was great. The starters were amazing also! Highly recommend this place!
Delicious

Walked in for brunch. The supper menu looked interesting and was rated as Michelin guide restaurant. But was disappointed with the brunch menu. It was a sunny day and the porch seating did not have shades/umbrella. Did not have many vegetarian options so had to leave. But the staff was very kind and pleasant. #LetsGuide
Very very good. Shrimp dumplings were ok. The chicken gorgh was excellent and the eggplant fish was amazing. The yogurt topping was ootw.
The Happy Hour experience there was excellent. The restaurant is very popular, it filled up very fast after 5pm, so seating and wait time could be long. But it's definitely worth it.

Left because of waiting nearly 15 minutes and no server showing up. Looks like a great place, but despite informing them that I would like to order asap because of a 7 year old with me and the time being later at night, not one server passing by stopped.
Great brunch. Bottomless mimosas. The salmon eggs Benedict was amazing. Hash instead of English muffins or bagels. I need to return and try all the egg dishes for sure.

Loved the mini art gallery in the basement. The downstairs had a great vibe. Only one of the 2bears downstairs was staffed and the were not any servers so it was a bit tough getting drinks. The food smelled and looked amazing. I will definitely go back to try it.
Amazing food great servoce beautiful atmosphere. Great for vegan gluten free people too!
Superb menu. Very helpful wait staff.
Great service, fantastic Lamb. Will absolutely be back.

Went for the first time. Read reviews and thought it may be wonderful. Hostess and staff slow and not helpful. Noisy environment. Very noisy. Food so so. Nothing spectacular. Similar food and much better around dc. The attractive is that is …

Had a delightful brunch here - the dumplings are great as well as the Afghan inspired brunch dishes. Many of them are twists on brunch dishes one might find elsewhere, but the restaurant gives them a unique flavor profile. The space is gorgeous and the prices are reasonable as well. If you are up for drinks, I recommend the Afghan 75.

The food is wonderful, and there is a cocktail bar downstairs. It's also connected through to a wonderful coffee shop also on the lower level, and accessible through another entrance. It's medium price, but excellent fare.
Normally not my type of food but it was incredible.
Outstanding Afghan cuisine in a trendy spot
Food is decent, but not the best Afghan food in the area. Service was slow even on a random weeknight.  Bistro Aracosia is much better.

Lapis is as good as it gets-- period. The food is fantastic, drinks are expertly crafted, and the vibe is pleasant. I came here on a Saturday night around 8:30PM before hitting the Improv Club; the spot was busy as ever but not so crowded that it was unmanageable. I sat at the bar and had a couple of drinks, while making conversation with the ever-outgoing bartender. Great service, great drinks.  My friend and I then moved to the downstairs dining area (this is the place to be). An Afghan bistro that truly ties in years of authentic recipes, the restaurant eschews a culturally intimate atmosphere.  Here it's much easier to have a soft-spoken conversation while taking in the pleasantly decorated basement.  The cocktails, as mentioned, are fantastic. The food however is even better. The meats are cooked super tender and the qormas are bursting with flavor. You can tell that everything is prepared fresh; the home-cooked feel is simply intoxicating.  I Liked: Chicken Qorma - A traditional Afghani dish (also very popular in India & Pakistan), Qorma is best served with rice (order rice separately). The chicken in the dish is cooked so tender that it simply melts in your mouth and the flavors of the curry are pungent without being overbearing. 5/5  Rice w/ Carrots and Raisins - A sweeter rice that pairs well with the chicken qorma. I enjoyed the pickled carrots and raisins. 5/5  Afghan Mule - It's a regular moscow mule (not sure about the Afghan prefix) but it tastes great and presentation is perfect. The ginger beer is made in-house, a nice touch that really makes this drink refreshing. 5/5  Summer Shandy - A drink that doesn't take itself too seriously and reminds me of summertime lemonade. 5/5  I Disliked: Nothing!

Excellent quality food and great ambience. It's not too dark/intimate for casual get-togethers, nor is it bright/sterile, so it's a great spot for any size or type of group. The soup was beyond excellent, as were the specialty cocktails. Service was very good, and it's in a very convenient location. We'll be back!
Cute, cozy and very tasty. The shrimp dumplings and sambosas were excellent! Service was a bit on the slow side. However.
Everything was impeccably seasoned and super succulent. Also, perfect portion sizes.
I loved the atmosphere so much. Great service.
Adorable ambience and great food! Perfect for a special occasion. The mantu beef and qabuli palow are a must.
Excellent food and very nice staff. Thank you 😍🌷

Seated at a table for 2, it was very cramped, almost shoulder to shoulder with other customers.  Service was okay, sometimes condescending, but got the job done.  I've never eaten Afghani food, but it was sort of a plain style of Indian-Pakistani food, taste was good, but I left craving bolder flavors.  The one exception was a garbanzo cilantro mint cold stew or salad thing that was incredible.  Also rice options were fantastic, seems odd to have about rice, but these are worth the praise, sort of a mix between a biryani and a pilaf.  I'll probably go back, but not rushing to get there.  Almost forgot, their cocktails were fantastic!  Looked like a decent beer and wine selection too.  You won't be disappointed, just not thrilled.
(Translated by Google) Very good food  (Original) Muy buena comida
Seating is really tight but the food was great. Loved the smaller plates more than the kabob. I want to go back and explore more of the menu.
What a great experience.  The service was superb despite the restaurant being full.  High marks for food quality and ambiance.
Great food. Plenty Gluten free. Great for a date.
